title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, dealing with the issues of racial injustice and moral growth.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and the struggle for freedom and individuality.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel exploring the issues of class, marriage, and morality in early 19th-century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel set in the Jazz Age, portraying the extravagant and disillusioned lives of the wealthy elite.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the adventures of a young wizard.
